Package com.example.group1hrmsapp.service

Interface UserService

All Known Implementing Classes:
UserServiceImpl
public interface UserService

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void deleteUserById​(java.lang.String userName)
    Deletes an AppUser entity from the repository based on the provided username.
    java.lang.String generateJwtToken​(java.lang.String username)
    Generates a JWT token for the provided username.
    java.lang.Object getAllUsers()
    Retrieves all AppUser entities from the repository.
    AppUser getUserById​(java.lang.String userName)
    Retrieves an AppUser entity by the given username.
    void saveUser​(AppUser appUser)
    Saves the provided AppUser entity to the repository.

  • Method Details

    • getUserById

      AppUser getUserById​(java.lang.String userName)
      Retrieves an AppUser entity by the given username.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the AppUser to retrieve.
      Returns:
      An AppUser object if a user with the given username is found, otherwise a RuntimeException is thrown.
      Throws:
      java.lang.RuntimeException - If a user with the given username is not found in the repository.

    • saveUser

      void saveUser​(AppUser appUser)
      Saves the provided AppUser entity to the repository. The user's password will be encoded before saving.
      Parameters:
      appUser - The AppUser entity to be saved. The user's password in this object should be in plain text, as this method will handle the password encoding.

    • deleteUserById

      void deleteUserById​(java.lang.String userName)
      Deletes an AppUser entity from the repository based on the provided username.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the AppUser to be deleted.

    • getAllUsers

      java.lang.Object getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all AppUser entities from the repository.
      Returns:
      A list of all AppUser entities stored in the repository.

    • generateJwtToken

      java.lang.String generateJwtToken​(java.lang.String username)
      Generates a JWT token for the provided username. The token will expire one hour after its creation time.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for which to generate a JWT token.
      Returns:
      A JWT token as a string, signed with HS512 algorithm and the provided secret key.
